Reviews.Title: Good but doesn't always work.
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I like the ease of set up, the video quality; however it does not work consistently and I find this frustrating.  I can not make sense of when it works and when it doesn't.  I don't know if it's because my home's wiring is older or if the product is faulty.  When it is working - it is great.  Another thing to be aware of is that it's very tedious to get rid of video footage that you no longer want.  Each tiny segment has to be deleted one piece at a time.  I haven't found a way to delete large chunks of time; such as deleting one day.

Reviews.Title: Cannot be used as a standalone alarm for business.
Reviews.Author: T. G. Kraft
Reviews.Content: OK, I like the camera, seems to work most of the time but something keeps taking the cameras off line and requires a power cycle to get them back on-line.  It could be the building power (Historic district, 80 year old house) and I'm running two cameras 300' from the main panel.  Not the level of reliability I was looking for in my business, but finding a way to make it work.  I went with the Pro upgrade and it needs more features.  I should be able to control all aspects of the command center remotely but cannot change brightness (for example), but what is there seems to work fine.I'm using snap shot alerts sent via multi media to my blackberry, they are slow and not considered useful in catching someone in the act.  Sometimes I get the multi media alert 24 hours later.  Could be AT&T;, but haven't figured it out yet.You really should have a dedicated computer to run more than three cameras, it chews up disk space and bandwidth fast.  We noticed a serious slow down of our database applications when the cameras are on.Super easy to install, software is easy to understand.Great monitoring tool, not a great alarm system.Extra cameras are too expensive when compared with other systems.

Reviews.Title: A good, inexpensive video security system
Reviews.Author: R. Roach
Reviews.Content: I purchased one outdoor camera to monitor my driveway.  The 15-minute setup is not likely to occur, in my opinion.  It took me about a half an hour.  I had to change my firewall settings.  Once it was determined that it worked, it took another hour to mount the camera outside. For this price, I am impressed.  I asked my alarm company what they would charge and they say $4,000 or more.  The quality is good, it is recording based on motion detection.  The software is easy to use.  I am not interested in remote features so I can't speak to them. I think this is a great product, and am considering to add another camera.

Reviews.Title: Caught a culprit, then became a turtle cam!
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: I initially bought this camera system in Sept. 09 to mount on the front of my house to figure out who was walking their dog late at night and letting it poop up and down the sidewalk on my block (was an on-going regular problem for months).  I was able to adjust the brightness and contrast under the camera set up options in the command center to get a good night picture on a dimly lit city block. With the adjustments, the picture was good enough at night to see who was passing by, and it even captured opossums at night. There was a lot more activity on my street than I was aware of.  I was able to set the camera recording area and sensitivity to not pick up movement across the street, just on my side of the street.  And I caught the culprit...After figuring out who the inconsiderate neighbor was, I moved the camera next to my raised pond in my backyard, where my turtle (Stephen Colbertle the Turtle) lives. I've wanted a turtle cam since building the pond! Stephen is a red eared slider, so I hardly ever get glimpses of him out of the water.  Now, I can see him up close and personal whenever he gets out to bask in the sun.  I've adjusted the camera sensitivity so it doesn't record (video on my computer) when the wind blows the pond plants a little, and I've set the brightness and contrast to auto-adjust (which works with the sunlight changes thoughout in the day).  I've set up a free account on the wilife website so I can even log in and check on my turtle when I'm at work.  It doesn't make for super exciting viewing but its pretty cool (okay, has been called geeky).When the camera was in my front yard, it was close to my computer inside the house (just one wall between camera and computer). Now that it is in the backyard, there are three rooms between where the computer and camera are, and some yard space, and there are no problems with the picture.I haven't had any problems with the camera, and I think the software program with command center is very easy to use and intuitive. If my camera dies, I will buy another one (if out of warrantee), and I am considering buying some additional ones to add to my system (watching for price drops).One thing I would recommend to anyone purchasing, rather than using the CD that comes with the camera to load the software, go to the wilife website and download the most up to date software for the system.I didn't expect the camera to work as well as it has (but I was tired of the dog poop on the sidewalk, and stopping that was enough motivation to give the camera a try).  So far, it has worked great for me and I am very pleased with this product.EDIT 12/1/11: I bought a second outdoor add-on camera in Dec. 2009, and both of my cameras are still working two years later.

Reviews.Title: Didn't stand the test of time
Reviews.Author: Michael Hershberger
Reviews.Content: When I first got the system and installed it, I was excited.  Installation was easy.  It started right up.  It was sending me email alerts.  I could access my cameras from the internet.  How cool was that!!But now 3 months later the bloom is off the rose, and I am ready to scrape it or send it back.  It is just too unreliable. I have my system at a location that I only visit once a week.  I would estimate that less than 25% of the time does it make through an entire week with all three primary functions (local recording, email alerts, internet viewing) all working, all week.  And it's not just one thing.  It's multiples.  Logitec's help system always has suggestions but reliability never improves and the same problems continue to repeat.So unless you can physically access the system daily and/or are ok with parts of the system going down for periods of time, I would stay away from this product.Great idea.  Flawed execution.

Reviews.Title: response to O. Mccoy "mccoy"
Reviews.Author: Ann Parks
Reviews.Content: These cameras are set up for 24 hour motion detection right out of the box. If you need them to record constantly, then you need to create a schedule and tell them to do so. Make sure you have alot of hard drive space because the files are huge, due to the quality of video.Also, if there are times that you want recording to be off, you also have to schedule it and tell the cameras to not alert or record.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: D. Warner
Reviews.Content: As usual Logitech exceeded my expectations. This system is a perfect all-in-one camera/dvr setup ready to use right out of the box, just make shure your own a decent PC. Out of all of my computers the Intel Duel-Core(@1.7ghz each)processor works the best. Execelent picture quality surpassing even some high end panasonic and sony systems I have used through busnesses. Very easy to use, hardest part would be mounting the camera.Tough built-temp. already been below recommended operating temp in my area, still no problems.Extention cords of any lenght don't effect performance.IMPORTANT: completly weatherproof connections NOT with tape. if possable run under edge of roof or if possable use garage power source. I highly recommend this product, if you buy it just to test it I bet you will keep it.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Savarese Jr. "Sandman"
Reviews.Content: One word...Outstanding.  The WiLife system misses NOTHING...even a deer in the driveway at 3:45 am gets recorded.  The system is easly expandable and I will be adding more cameras soon.

Reviews.Title: logitech outdoor camera fix C26 C27 C31 C32
Reviews.Author: steven a markham
Reviews.Content: The Logitech Wilife outdoor cameras have a known defect (caps melting).[...]They fail in about a year. This is due to the following four 1000uF caps: C26 C27 C31 C32. The initial was a10v cap then later releases were 16v. I replaced them with 25v. See Digikey part number UHE1E102MHD6.  The caps are from Nichicon and are Aluminum Electrolytic.  They are rated for 10,000 hours at 105 degrees C. The caps don't fit perfectly (the original are 8mm diameter versus 12.5mm that I put in) so insulate the leads and let them float above the circuit board.

Reviews.Title: Good Value for the Cost...
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Provencher "ppro"
Reviews.Content: After a few neighborhood events and some teenage pranks on our home, I decided I wanted something to give me a view to what goes on outside my house.I found the system to be very easy to install.  The cameras may be placed anywhere there is a solid surface to mount them, and a way to run power to them.  The power line supplies the video feed so there is nothing else to wire.  I put three cameras in by simply affixing them to my house and running the power to a convenient outlet out of reach of outsiders.The receiving end of the video is a box that plugs into the regular power outlet in the wall, and the USB plug on the back of a computer.  The software installs very easily.In my case, the cameras came online immediately and the video image is reasonably good quality.I did run into one problem that I have not been able to solve.  And Logitech Customer service has been totally unresponsive to my submitted problem reports:  I cannot access the cameras from the free web site they provide for this purpose.  I believe the problem is related to my internet service provider configuration, my wireless router, firewall and IP addresses.  I suspect a session with customer service would get me through this, but no such luck yet.Notwithstanding my inability to get customer service and remote viewing, the system works great and records any movement detected to my hard drive for live or later viewing.  I can see the comings and goings, and also what's going on at night.  One caution - the cameras do not work in darkness without some sort of light source.  In my case, I have motion activated spots that are pointed at the same areas as the cameras so I get good images of any motion at night.  My friend who bought this system but does not have outdoor lighting, does not get any images at night, even though the cameras will detect motion and come on.  So purchase some motion-activated spotlights or another system.  Also, the infrared lighting that Logitech sells is not for the outdoor cameras so keep that in mind.Overall, I think this solution does a decent job of adding to my security profile.

Reviews.Title: Good idea, Great possibilities, Satisfied with product
Reviews.Author: Pinney
Reviews.Content: I have had a Logitech WiLife Security system for over two years and there is a lot that I am satisfied with.  It was easy to install, the motion detection that can be activated by each individual camera is great and saves having a constant recording, connecting to my computer by house wiring is a great idea and one of the best features that I like about this system.  I am operating two cameras.  One of the went bad after an year and Logitech replaced it promptly.  I can keep at least four months of motion detection videos from two cameras on my computer and use less than 20 gig's.  With cats and other animals around, there are a lot of video recording.  To be able to attach this to my computer is another great feature of this product.  I have two desk top computers and I leave them on 24 hours a day 365 days a year.  I have done this for at least 7 years ahd have never had a hard drive go bad.  This is mainly due to very good battery backups.  Since I was already keeping my computers on, the Logitech system adapted well to my setup.  The only complaint I have is that I wish the cameras could produce clearer pictures.  I cannot read the letters and numbers on vehicle license plates that come down my driveway.  When compared to other security systems that a home owner can buy, these cameras are just as good or better.  I firmly believe Logitech has a great product and I wish they could improve the cameras. Everything else works great. I can also view the recordings when I am away from my home.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: W. Stoddart
Reviews.Content: This product worked just as described.  The setup was very easy.  The camera works over the electrical system in your house so all you do is plug in the camera and the reciever and you are good to go.  I was able to get the camera to work over a hundred feet from the receiver as long as it is on the same electrical system.  The camera can be easily set to record and it can be set to be very sensitive to movement, so it is good for security.  The system is very easy to access online.  The only problem I had was that I had to adjust my firewall to allow the camera in but one short call to tech support and they had me fixed up.Con:  The only thing I didn't like is that the pan and zoom features they promote when accessing the camera online are only available for extra money.

Reviews.Title: A breeze to install, easy to use
Reviews.Author: E. S.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this outdoor camera after considering virtually every other option out there, including various IP cameras.  My intention was to use it to show my driveway, as stuff has been stolen out of my vehicles over the past few months while they were right in my driveway.  I had a couple of concerns about this product, primarily the 15 fps frame rate (which was half of other cams), the rated temperature it could withstand (I live in the northeast), and the low-light capabilities.I ended up purchasing it after seeing the high cost of various outdoor IP cams, and the fact that they were more involved to install.  I'm tech savvy, but not interested in doing wiring.  Turns out this cam solved all of my concerns.First, the outdoor cam is extremely easy to install.  Up and running just as advertised, although I will have to drill a big hole behind the cam to run the power cord through.  Be advised that it is permanently affixed to the cam, meaning that you will have to drill a big enough hole through wherever it's mounted to fit the plug end of the cord.  Drilling that hole is really the biggest issue with this camera.  If you don't have to do that, you're golden.With regard to the 15 fps, during the daytime it's no issue at all.  Very smooth and clear.  At night however, I've found 15 fps isn't quite enough to get perfectly smooth video.  It's a bit jerky, but not overly so.  For my purposes, it works.  You wouldn't want to use it at night professionally though, I dont think.  With regard to its low light capability, I was pleasantly surprised.  I live in a suburb of NYC, so we have street lights and neighbors close by, so there's always quite a bit of ambient light about.  Therefore, even before my motion-activated lights turn on and brighten my driveway, it gives a pretty good picture.  If you are out in the middle of nowhere where there isnt a lot of ambient light, your results may differ, but it should be fine anywhere you have any additional lights about.Finally, I was concerned about the durability of the cam itself.  I believe it says it's temperature rated down to about freezing, which concerned me, but I just used it during a blizzard and sub-freezing temps and there were no issues.  Not sure how that affects product life, but time will tell.Viewing the cam online is a snap, and provides various good alert functions to send the alerts to either an email address or a cell phone.  You can limit the sensitivity of the camera itself so it doesnt record every time car headlights reflect off you windows, and limit the area in which the camera will attempt to detect motion.  Very helpful.  You can only view a live feed online, not the recorded video, unless you purchase a platinum package from Logitech, currently valued at about $80 for the year.  I just recevied a $20 off email though, so I am considering it.  It provides additional features other than uploading your video to their server for viewing and storing (for the safety conscious), and also includes the ability to pan, tilt and zoom their indoor cams.The only real drawbacks are the lack of audio (not needed for my purposes), and the 15 fps at night.  Otherwise, this is a great cam, which can be added seamlessly to their other indoor cams.  It is cheaper than other good outdoor wireless IP cams, requires no wiring and does the job as advertised for residential purposes.  Not sure about using it commercially, as I have no need for that.  Overall, I highly recommend it for home use.

Reviews.Title: Caveat Emptor With This Security System
Reviews.Author: Candor Guy "candorguy"
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a fairly reasonable outdoor security camera system.  Installation was a breeze.  However, I was very disappointed that the outdoor camera lasted less than two months!  As a result, it has been over five months collecting dust on my shelf.  Despite the fact that I have five months of warranty left.  Forget about brand loyalty; this outdoor security camera is the pits!  Customer service?  They should know by now, that this outdoor camera gets very hot.  And as a result, it is bound to fail--pure and simple!  Spend more time on quality control!  If I had my way, this camera is for the highway and gets no stars. My advice is to stay away from this product!

Reviews.Title: Logitech WiLife Digital Video Security--Outdoor Master System Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Burrell
Reviews.Content: I am not a GEEK but this product makes me feel like one. Software is VERY easy to install and use. It looks great and everyone I have sent videos rave about the clarity! Highly recomend!!

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't recognize my receiver
Reviews.Author: Patricia Tague
Reviews.Content: I plugged in the reveiver right next to the computer and it wouldn't recognize the receiver.I emailed them and they did't get back with me.So I filed for a return on the product and all they could say was it was a manufacturers warranty.. So what does that mean?Don't buy from this company... They aren't good about returns.

Reviews.Title: GARBAGE!!
Reviews.Author: Carl R. Hopper
Reviews.Content: This is total JUNK! Does not find USB receiver during setup, tech support phone # is out of service as well as Wilife website!I would not even pay $5.00 for this crap! Wish I could rate it a -5 instead of 1.

Reviews.Title: Nice system
Reviews.Author: RB "Ron"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to deter and catch the little criminals that stole some cherished items off my front porch. I had a lot of difficulty connecting this system to my pc. The wireless adapter driver was not being recognized by my pc. After much patience and persevere I finally got it to work. I order a second camera and it was a breeze once the system was set up. Every once in a while the system crashes or stops. Other than that issue it works well. So far no more thefts have occurred.

Reviews.Title: Appears these are nolonger supported by LogiTech
Reviews.Author: Computer Geek "Computer Geek"
Reviews.Content: From the title of my review I found this out AFTER I BOUGHT SIX OF THESE CAMERAS $$$$$$$$$...I hadn't thought to look on Amazon regarding reviews of these cameras..Logitech isn't very or non sympathetic regarding people who have bought these...The ad is misleading as well.One picture shows the command center opened; EXCEPT that isn't the the command center you get, yes it is in the disk BUT you have to subscribe to what Logitech calls their "Platinum Service" to access all of the features and added features not included in their unreliable "free" online access...This sounds like I am bashing Logitech and I am - THEY DESERVE IT.. This is also from personal experience in this product..The cameras keep going offline and the connection is always bad; why I do not know since my house has all new wiring..The screen titles have disappeared for each of the cameras in the command center and redoing them doesn't bring them back.I checked disable the "blinking LED" on the cameras so anyone there wouldn't see them in the dark when they are tripped and give the cameras location away.. YET THEY CONTINUE TO BLINK WHEN MOTION IS DETECTED...I have them about six feet off the ground on the wall; I figure by the time they see or find the camera I have their picture; cameras are cheaper than the item they are watching..Another is the REQUIREMENT that you have to use windows media player to view video remotely meaning no "droid" phone can be used; ONLY A WINDOWS PHONE CAN BE USED.... Also unless you pay extra for this "Platinum" service you can't stream continuously; you only get about three minutes connection and then you have to reconnect for another three minutes to view..Windows 7 it can be run on; BU remember NOT to have your font set to larger than normal - you will get the screen resolution error and software install will abort..Also Windows 8 forget it it won't run on it...The cameras also get hot and that is from inside; not from the sun being on them.Another poster pointed out the caps in them fail due to the cheap design and build by Logitech...It appears they may run fine using one maybe two cameras; but using six unreliable for me..As for the six camera limit; why? I don't know why Logitech set this limit..Yes you can run more than six; but that will take another separate computer or maybe running multiple command centers in Virtual machines on one system; but I am not going to spend the money to try that.I will be replacing the caps as one poster showed how and selling off these pieces of "fine technology" since I bought six "master" kits. I will sell them after they have tested "reliable" first..I am looking at wired/wireless pan and tilt cameras now and should have spent the extra few hundred dollars in the first place; yet Logitech has good products; except for this one...The system I am using to run these cameras on is more way more than powerful enough to do the job...08/2013:Update...These cameras have NO IR Ability; meaning you have to have "normal" white light motion lights installed to see in the dark after they light up.Using the IR Lighting will NOT WORK...Now you want to drive your next door neighbor nuts at night then use these cameras and ALL NIGHT LONG YOUR LIGHTS GO OFF AND ON DETECTING the "cats" or what ever..As already mentioned the "online" wilife limited streaming has gotten so bad it is useless..IF the limited streaming had worked fine then maybe I'd pay the "platinum" service but forget it...I have since thrown these into a box and changed over to I.P cameras and web server with encryption.This system works on "DROID" phones.The wilife only works on "windows" phones because the video streaming is in WMV format meaning you have to use Microsoft's "silverlight" to see the streaming.. Silverlight WILL NOT WORK ON A DROID PHONE. A person WAS working on porting it over to work on "droid" yet they had the cr*p sued out of them by you know who.....As I and many other have mentioned these Cameras are no longer supported by Logitech and you would most likely be wasting your money buying them. I wasted allot of money buying six of these "cameras" and more to buy other that are allot better and more usable.. Example the outside hanging dome cameras IP type are similar in price and allot better; they pan/tilt and some zoom as well as work on ALL smart phones and have IR ability at night...If I could as some other posters have mentioned would give this item a NEGATIVE RATING...

Reviews.Title: Werks.exe crashed
Reviews.Author: Christine N. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when i installed and set this unit up running. It worked well. i tested online viewing on the 1st day, it worked well then I ordered the indoor unit. But 2 days later, I can not online viewing anymore. Evey time to log on to view , can not detect the cameras or over streaming message come up. Then when i got home , my main computer which the cameras were hooked to got an error message werks.evxe is not responding and need to shut down program.  I called Logitech support. They said they were beware of the werks.exe crash but don't know how to fix it. i went on Logitech's forum and saw lots people is complaining about this werks.exe crash.  I am going to return these 2 cameras. My intent to view online on my dog and tortoises but I can not.

Reviews.Title: DOA - Shipped in plain brown box - Used or Refurbed??
Reviews.Author: Adirondack "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Upon reciept of the camera, software and adapter I was slightly disturbed in that the packaging was a plain, brown box.  It was not retail packaged and the components were wrapped in bubble wrap.  Included were two pages of poorly copied instructions.  The software did not run on my Windows 7 Pro which initiated my first call to Logitech Tech Support.  They answered my call in 5-rings and solved my problem in three steps.Next I attempted to setup the camera and usb adapter to no avail.  Again a call to Logitech support, 8-rings and answered.  Turns out that my usb adapter was DOA which lead me to believe that I was shipped a repackaged return from the seller.Logitech has offered a replacement USB thing upon receipt of proof of purchase. We'll see how this turns out.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: J. T. Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for an external view of my driveway, the fact that it would send the signal across the power line really appealed to me as I did not want to run cable for a camera.I had the USB powerline adapter on the exact same circuit breaker line on a computer in my house that I used to monitor the camera, record images, etc.The device is completely unreliable, it will drop the feed and you have no idea anything is wrong until you check on it. I had to reboot the camera and/or powerline adapter once every couple of days.I bought another computer specifically for the camera thinking a closer range might help. I put a computer in my garage which defeated the entire purpose of using this product to begin with. This lasted about two months and the camera and/or powerline adapter completely died. The camera can no longer be identified, I suppose after reading similar comments the camera burned out.For 250 dollars this is a complete waste of money, they also mislead you with the 'advanced features' in the software that should be part of the entire suite but they don't tell you that until after you buy it. Overall I think its a poorly engineered device, and more importantly it is completely unreliable. Obviously it was hit and miss for about a year and I am out of my warranty, the support people are also completely clueless as to how their own product works, I had to manually edit the configuration file to get mine to work.Overall, its an interesting novelty but the picture is jerky, by the time it takes a snapshot the activity has long since passed.I would highly recommend another product, I wasted 250 dollars, the components themselves are made in China and are worth maybe 20 dollars tops.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Joe Vegas "Java 1"
Reviews.Content: I tried this camera out for about 25 days and I am sending it back.  It's an OK camera overall but the software is not very intuitive and it keeps losing the signal from the camera.  To reset it you have to reset the camera which you can't do from the remote Internet site.  I'm looking for a better system.

Reviews.Title: Quality and camera life are terrible
Reviews.Author: Jack Pine "Jack"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over a year ago and from the beginning the image quality was questionable.  After about 1 year, the outdoor camera burned out.  I contacted their customer support, but they were unable to assist.  I then took the camera back to the store where I purchased it and they only offered to give me a discount on another one, so, like a fool, I bought another one.  This time the camera burned out within 3 months.  If you want a camera that will last, this is not the camera for you!

Reviews.Title: Manufacturer Support Does not Exist
Reviews.Author: Maggie H. "MAGS"
Reviews.Content: The camera works.  The software works.  I tried originally to install on laptop and it did not work at all (USB obviously not sufficient).  Tried to remove software.  Can't do it as it keeps running.  Tried to contact "Support" via email and phone - does not work.  If you have problems, pack it up and send it back.  Waited on phone over 11 minutes just to be disconnected.  It's OK.  No more/no less.  Don't know how to store info.  They want you to buy "Platinum" to do more (zoom, etc.).  False advertising if you think you"ll get that with the regular package.  I am not inclined to spend more considering the total lack of Customer Support.  I, personally, would rather spend more and have the support.  Will never buy this brand name in the future.Logitech WiLife Digital Video Security--Outdoor Master System Camera

Reviews.Title: Easy.. but not reliable at all
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You "Chris"
Reviews.Content: The product was very easy to set up, but is not reliable. I find that 35% of the time i go to check the cameras they are not working and take a while to get up again. I am not getting good range on the cameras either. 30' at the most. I might be doing something wrong, but i have read the instructions many times... I do NOT recommend this product... Way more expensive than it should be... doesn't work well... add on cameras are ridiculously expensive... not reliable at all

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: C. Butcher "TCB"
Reviews.Content: I have installed these on several households now. If you have a computer that is fast enough to support them and your normal use then it's great. I used my older desktop I don't use for anything else. Works great on all the households. On older houses you have take special consideration on where you plug them in and how many are on the same circuit. Plug and play pretty much. In older houses or older wiring use only one camera per breaker circuit. Seem to work fine that way without any issues. If you always have unsteady power to your house they might lag when your power level shifts. Works in low light but not the best. Best thing for households and small businesses.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Fortunecookie
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with the purchase but did not like that you had to pay for an additional fee if you wanted to get an arial / zoom view.  This was not stated in the description of the product.  Furthermore, I thought is was on the pricey side with having to spend the same amount for additional cameras. For the price, it would have been nice for night vision.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: D. Aaquil "DZA"
Reviews.Content: Installation of the outdoor camara was a little long but more so due to it being placed on the exterior of my home. I had to drill a hole big enough to fit the cord and plug which plugs into an interior outlet. Once I patched the hole, turned on the pc and synced them, the security system was up and running. No problem. I have the motion sensor on. It sends a image when the camara detects motion. Beautiful!!!!

Reviews.Title: Bad Product and Services
Reviews.Author: jonnii
Reviews.Content: I still own fours Logitech WiLife security cameras in my garage. The quality of the video was not good or sharp. The system worked for awhile with my old router. When my AT&T; modem/router went out, I bought Cisco Linksys Router from Walmart. Then, my WiLife security cameras did not work. The new router was not compatible with WiLife camera. I called to Logitech Tech Support and they was not able to help me. They said they no long make this model any more. Now I bought new camera system and removed these Logitech WiLife and placed them in the garage. Please don't buy these cameras. They are old and no longer produced by Logitech.

Reviews.Title: Woud not install.
Reviews.Author: ivan e lazo
Reviews.Content: Kept getting "driver initialization error" message. Tried re-install, different computers and also different versions of Command software. Total waste of money at this point. Check forums and note it is not an isolated problem.

Reviews.Title: Came in handy
Reviews.Author: William D. Pearson
Reviews.Content: It worked right out of the box.  The camera has poor resolution but is adequate for a security camera (which wasn't the purpose I wanted it for).  I'm able to use the camera in an out-building on our property and view the image on a computer in the house (we don't have a computer network, which WAS one of the reasons I purchased the system).  As it turned out, the system has been a godsend. We have a "semi-feral" cat that lives in our shed.  She got sick and we can't pick her up to take her to a vet.  We've used the system to monitor the effects of our care and her eating/drinking.  It's been great to see how she's doing just by looking at the computer and watch her get better.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Krisna Gilbert
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this camera setup.  It was very easy to install and get results quickly needed for security reasons.

Reviews.Title: Video Security Camera is a GREAT Addition!
Reviews.Author: Michael Diggs
Reviews.Content: Added to my now complete home security camera system.  Great outdoor view, clear and picks up birds flying by.  Excellent camera and Logitech system!

Reviews.Title: Works as design
Reviews.Author: Papico
Reviews.Content: Product arrived on time, works as design, the only bad thing is that doesnt works with android phones to watch remotely all the cameras.

Reviews.Title: A good price to keep my old camera system working
Reviews.Author: Randy I. Mcquerry
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for an outdoor Wilife camera that quit working. I didn't want to replace the entire system with the upgrade Logitech system because of cost, so I just replaced this one camera. I found this one on Amazon at a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: Wilife
Reviews.Author: L. knight
Reviews.Content: ProThis product has worked great so far, but this will take way more than the 15 minutes they say it will take! Installing the software and plugging the receiver into the wall and PC will take 15 minutes but mounting the camera and drilling any holes in the wall to run the wiring will take much longer especially if you have to go through a block wall like I did. Even with no night vision people can still be seen by the camera. To aide the camera I installed a light under it with a motion sensor on it that works great with the camera.ConThe price of buying additional cameras for this system is a little pricey and to get more functions is a little pricey too.

Reviews.Title: Say no to clepto's......
Reviews.Author: Way-Out
Reviews.Content: It doesn't do night time surveylance but if you have motion detecting lights they'll do. Daytime is great, motion censored and catches what's moving in the yard. Got it to watch over my metal rack when I'm out. We don't need any sticky fingers around and it works well, gives you some peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Whammy!
Reviews.Author: hoos30
Reviews.Content: I've only had my camera installed a for a little over three weeks so I can't speak to the longevity of the product, but so far this security suite has been great for us.  Ease of installation, picture quality, features (emailing motion detected images is great!) have been wonderful.I will update the review after I pass the dreaded 12 month mark.EDIT: Well, my camera died at the 11 month mark. Luckily, it was still under warrenty and Logitech promptly sent me a new camera.  Of course, they've put out the new Alert system in the meantime.  Maybe when this camera croaks I will upgrade to that one.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: kyle
Reviews.Content: Junk, this is a seriousness waste of  time and money doesn't hold the cameras signal , constantly rebooting to find camera ,junk

Reviews.Title: Junk, Works for 1 year at most
Reviews.Author: Panther
Reviews.Content: I purchased two outdoor cameras and one indoor camera. Everything was great for the first 6 months. After 6 months, once and a while the system would stop recognizing a camera and show it as not being available. The camera was plugged in with the LED lights flashing but it wasn't sending the video signal to the command center. The easy fix was to unplug the camera and wait a few minutes. This temporarily fixed the problem but the other cameras started doing the same thing. I called Logitech to troubleshoot the problem but customer support told me to unplug the camera and then plug it back in. I believe they were waiting for the warranty to run out so they didn't have to send me three new cameras. I googled the issue and noticed lots of reviews saying the cameras work for 6-12 months before they start having problems. A year and a half later, I have two cameras which work intermittently and one that doesn't work at all. What a great security system...

Reviews.Title: USB connection errors are maddening
Reviews.Author: J. Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought into this system in May 2009. I was looking for an easy to setup system that didn't require running cable(s) all over the place to monitor my property and to prove to the city that the kid next door and his friends were vandalizing my property and creating disturbances. I liked the idea of running the video signal through the house wiring. I have one camera installed on the front of my garage and one installed on the front porch. nobody enters the property without being detected....when the system works that is. (for the orginal intent it worked and it has been as quiet as a graveyard around here since the city saw the security video(s)of the problem neighbor's kid and his friends causing problems and clamped down on them.) Initially the wilife system worked as advertised, very easy setup, and decent video quality but After a few months I started losing detection of the cameras by the software due to "USB connection errors". For the past 13 months I never knew when the system was going to fail. I have tried everything I can think of to get this system to work reliably but to no avail. I have uninstalled and re-installed the software countless times, downloaded the latest versions of the software and I have tried every usb plug on my computer. I even went so far as to install a new addon USB2 card but the "USB" connection errors" persist. I have hve had no other issues with other USB peripherals installed on my computer.  I have searched the web looking for solutions, I have contacted Logitech tech support, all with no satisfaction. Sometimes if I unplug and replug the usb cable 15 or 20 times the system will stay on...for awhile. I'm sure many have had no problems with their Logitech Wilife system  and to you I say good for you. But to those of us who have had a multitude of problems with the Logitech Wilife system, we have suffered countles hours of maddening fustrations. If you choose to buy into the wilife system do so with the knowledge that it will be a "hit or miss" propostion regarding reliabity and once you spend your money you probably will not recover your investment if the return period has lapsed and you start to have problems. As for me, if I had it to do over again I would choose something else.On a final note. Let me put in a plug for Amazon.com. I have had nothing but a positive relationship with Amazon.com for the last six years or so that I have been buying from them. If and when I had a problem and had to return merchandise, for whatever reason if it was within the return time period Amazon would pay for the return with no hassle. I have used this "review forum" countless times to aid me in my decisions to buy a product.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and works great!
Reviews.Author: John V
Reviews.Content: This outdoor camera works very well and the program installation is very easy. I plan on adding  another outdoor camera to the system soon. Works well in low light conditions too.

Reviews.Title: Not as expected
Reviews.Author: Reil
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased this product, I would like to have known that there was no "sound alert" available unless you purchased an additional software upgrade. This is very deceptive marketing.The most valuable part of a security system is the protection it provides during occupancy.  If someone is breaking into (or intruding upon) another part of the house (or business) while I'm there ... well, Logitech thinks you're looking at the video even while sleeping.  Unless ... yep ... unless you pay for a software upgrade.  And if you want to "schedule" when the camera will run ... yep, pay for a software upgrade.As the only functional camera that works over house wiring (not running cable thru the attic), it was a very attractive system.  Now, after carefully "channeling" the plug-in connection to hide the power cord, I feel I'm "stuck" with this system.I'm angry, but I'll live with it.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: not what we expected
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Richardson "Rob"
Reviews.Content: Logitech WiLife Digital Video Security.. Outdoor Master System CameraIt was well made and tech support was good,but when we purchased it, they never said you couldn't use it in the dark at night without lighting. Also because our garage has has a separate electrical system from our home we wouldn't be able to use it without a computer in the garage. To much for us, to much to deal with.

Reviews.Title: Never worked
Reviews.Author: bigcat
Reviews.Content: This product never worked.  I've had good experiences with Logitech stuff before, but this was awful.  I spent two days trying to get this system to work.  Logitech customer service was polite and tried to help, but their answer was to send me an ethernet cable to run the receiver to the PC.  One problem-- THERE'S NO ETHERNET OUTLET ON THE RECEIVER!  It just has a place for a printer usb cord.  This was stupid; I sent it back.  Don't waste your money or time on this.  Get a system that runs on wifi or cables.  I've learned my lesson-- don't go cheap on security cam systems!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Mara
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use as a "doggy cam" to watch our dogs during the day.  It was fairly easy to set up. One small issue I had was with the Windows Firewall on my Vista machine.  I had everything matching the settings recommended by Logitech putting in an exception for the Wilife software, but I still could not get the remote viewing set up because it stated there was a problem with the firewall.  I finally just disabled the firewall temporarily, tried again, and of course that allowed it to get set up.  Then I put the firewall restrictions back in place allowing for the Wilife software, and it all worked just fine after that.  Minor hiccup.  The remote viewing is great - we're able to check in here and there throughout the day to see what the dogs are up to.  I just ordered another camera to add on to this system.  Very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Read Info
Reviews.Author: oldnick
Reviews.Content: Works well. Haven't tried web feature yet.Cam is 30 feet from house, looking @ house.Had trouble getting motion detect to work.Just set up one, large detectin zone box &records any motion: Termite guy, me mowing,birds, butterflies, even wasp in front of lenson the fly.

Reviews.Title: Security Over do
Reviews.Author: Infotect
Reviews.Content: This product was sold as "New" but obviously was used as it had a password setting which neither the manufacturer nor the vendor can locate.Once loaded, it is not usable and requires the same password to delete it from the HD.  The program is stuck on the computer and I am going to have to pay a computer guy $95 an hour to remove it.Beware of this product and the Vendor.

Reviews.Title: Not last
Reviews.Author: Simple Man
Reviews.Content: I had 3 defected units exchanged for warranty. Right now I had 1 dead( out of warranty). One more still working but I expected It will go out of service any day. I am looking another brand. This is a costly tried out for me.UPDATE: My last camera just die 2 weeks ago, May 2009. as I expected. Be careful when you choose this model.

Reviews.Title: Easy. Dependable. Effective.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey E Ellis
Reviews.Content: The Logitech unit is easy to install. I use a Sony Vaio laptop (it has to be good for something) and Windows 7. I had my unit functioning in less than 30 minutes, including the time to install the camera. I have a camera outside under an eave overlooking a pond. The picture quality is fine - at 15 frames per second, the action is choppy but certainly discernible. I can see the goldfinches eating at our feeder, the flag waving in the breeze and boats on the lake.I often connect remotely through Wilife.com to check on the property or I just use GotomyPC to log in remotely; both work.I am very satisfied with the setup and am adding a second camera. By using the electrical system to transmit the signal, there are no complex wiring instructions and everything works wirelessly.12/22/10 This equipment is being replaced by Logitech with a new generation of gear and is now discontinued.

Reviews.Title: Just don't get it evidently. ?????/
Reviews.Author: O. Mccoy "mccoy"
Reviews.Content: I bought the inside at sam's and the outside on here, but i can't get direct mode, and i can only get a few minutes or seconds of the recorded video, either i don't understand how, or it just doesn't do what i want it to do, if i leave it on record, the next day, it only gives small sections, i need something to record and be able to go back to it all of the hours of the day. Anybody responds, let me know. thanks omccoy

Reviews.Title: Wrong item sent
Reviews.Author: John Noonan
Reviews.Content: Amazon sent the wrong item and they cannot rush the correct item for some reason.  Consequently, I have an area at my office that has been broken into twice and a month after ordering this camera it is still unprotected because I have yet to receive the correct camera and system.
